summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Transportation and Infrastructure Committee of the Dallas City Council is convening for a special called meeting on December 5, 2023, at 11:00 AM. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers on the 6th floor of City Hall and will also be accessible via video conference. The primary purpose is to conduct candidate interviews for the Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport Board.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The main agenda item is the interviews of candidates for the Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport Board. This will involve a briefing led by Council Member Omar Narvaez, the Chair of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting is open to the public both in-person and virtually, with live broadcasting available on Spectrum Cable Channel 16 and online. There is a possibility of an executive session if discussions involve legal advice, property negotiations, or personnel matters.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek to evaluate and potentially recommend candidates for appointment to the Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport Board. Decisions regarding the selection of candidates will be made during this meeting. 

Overall, the meeting aims to ensure effective governance and oversight of the airport board's operations through the appointment of qualified individuals.
